Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / Click the "Continue" button to start the experiment.
An inoculation loop is taken.
Then it is heated in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner till red hot.
The loop is allowed to cool for a few seconds.
The tryptic soy broth culture tube is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened in presence of flame and the mouth is heated.
A loopful of culture is taken from the tube.
The mouth of the tube is again heat sterilized and plugged with cotton.
The tube is kept back on rack.
The litmus milk tube labeled as ‘TEST’ is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened in presence of flame and the mouth is heated.
The loopful of culture is inoculated into the TEST.
The mouth of the tube is again heat sterilized and plugged with cotton.
The tube is kept back on rack.
Do not put anything in the other tube that serves as ‘CONTROL’.
The TEST and CONTROL are taken into incubator.
Both the tubes are incubated at 37˚C for 24-48 hours.
After incubation, the tubes are taken to Laminar air flow chamber and the results are observed and interpreted.
